org.grouplens.lenskit.basic

Class TopNGlobalItemRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.basic.AbstractGlobalItemRecommender
      • org.grouplens.lenskit.basic.TopNGlobalItemRecommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalItemRecommender

    public class TopNGlobalItemRecommender
extends AbstractGlobalItemRecommender

    A global item recommender that recommends the top N items from a scorer.

    Since:
    1.1

    • Method Detail

      • globalRecommend

        protected List<ScoredId> globalRecommend(LongSet items,
                                         int n,
                                         LongSet candidates,
                                         LongSet exclude)

        Implement the ID-based recommendation in terms of the scorer. This method uses getDefaultExcludes(LongSet) to supply a missing exclude set.

        Specified by:
        globalRecommend in class AbstractGlobalItemRecommender
        Parameters:
        items - The items ID.
        n - The number of items to return, or negative to return all possible items.
        candidates - The candidate set.
        exclude - The set of excluded items, or null to use the default exclude set.
        Returns:
        A scored list of item IDs.
        See Also:
        GlobalItemRecommender.globalRecommend(Set, int, Set, Set)

      • getDefaultExcludes

        protected LongSet getDefaultExcludes(LongSet items)

        Get the default exclude set for a item in the global recommendation. The base implementation returns the input set.

        Parameters:
        items - The items for which we are recommending.
        Returns:
        The set of items to exclude.

      • recommend

        protected List<ScoredId> recommend(int n,
                                   SparseVector scores)

        Pick the top n items from a score vector.

        Parameters:
        n - The number of items to recommend.
        scores - The scored item vector.
        Returns:
        The top n items from scores, in descending order of score.
